resources.string: Abdominal muscles including rectus abdominis, obliques, and transverse abdominis
Upper and lower arm muscles including biceps, triceps, and forearms
Pectoral muscles including pectoralis major and pectoralis minor
Back muscles including latissimus dorsi, rhomboids, and trapezius
Leg muscles including quadriceps, hamstrings, and calves
Gluteal muscles including gluteus maximus, medius, and minimus
Deep core muscles including transverse abdominis and erector spinae
Comprehensive exercises that engage multiple muscle groups
Exercises designed to elevate heart rate and improve cardiovascular health
Stand with feet together, jump and spread legs while raising arms overhead
Run in place lifting knees as high as possible
Begin in standing position, drop to push-up position, return to standing, and jump
In plank position, rapidly alternate bringing knees to chest
Simulate jumping rope, rotating wrists and jumping on balls of feet
Alternate legs in lunge position with a jump between transitions
In plank position, jump feet out and in like jumping jacks
Lie on back with knees bent, lift shoulders towards knees
Seated with elevated feet, rotate torso side to side
Lie on back, alternate bringing elbow to opposite knee
Lie on back, raise legs to 90 degrees and lower without touching floor
Hold push-up position with weight on forearms and toes
Balance on forearm and side of foot with body straight
Lie on back, simultaneously lift legs and upper body to form V shape
Start in plank position, lower chest to ground and push back up
Using chair or bench, lower body by bending elbows then push back up
Push-ups with hands close together forming diamond shape
Extend arms and make small circles forward and backward
In plank position, alternate touching opposite shoulder with hand
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, lower hips as if sitting in chair
Step forward and lower back knee towards ground, alternate legs
Lie on back with knees bent, lift hips off floor
Stand and rise onto balls of feet, lower and repeat
Wide-stance squats with toes pointed outward
Lean against wall in sitting position with knees at 90 degrees
Lie on side and lift top leg upward
From standing, walk hands out to plank and back
Move forward and backward on hands and feet with knees hovering above ground
Alternate between forearm plank and high plank positions
Lie on stomach and lift arms and legs simultaneously
Using kettlebell or dumbbell, swing from between legs to chest height
Standard burpee with added push-up at bottom position
Superman position while pulling arms back as if rowing
On hands and knees, extend opposite arm and leg
Lie face down, sweep arms from sides to overhead
Lie face down, kick legs up and down
Downward dog position, bend elbows to lower head toward ground
Raise arms to sides then overhead, lower and repeat
Series of arm positions resembling letters Y, T, W, and L
Lie on back, extend opposite arm and leg while keeping low back flat
Bird dog with elbow to knee crunch in between
Lie on back, elevate shoulders and legs while keeping low back pressed to floor
Lie on back with legs extended upward, rotate legs side to side
